2020-07-19T15:15:25Z: Thanks for joining us for this triple header, you lovely lot get a weekend away from us! We'll see you for Silverstone - take care!
2020-07-19T15:14:37Z: And here's the report! F1 Hungarian GP: Hamilton dominates in wet-dry race, Verstappen recovers to secondMercedes' Lewis Hamilton dominated an otherwise breath-taking wet-to-dry 2020 Formula 1 Hungarian Grand Prix, as Max Verstappen held off a charging Valtteri Bottas to take second for Red Bull
2020-07-19T15:05:28Z: No podium robots this week, sadly - they've been retired. Rumours that one of them has gone rogue is as yet unfounded...
2020-07-19T15:03:43Z: ...aaaand the bottom 10: 11. Leclerc, 12. Kvyat, 13. Norris, 14. Ocon, 15. Grosjean, 16. Raikkonen, 17. Giovinazzi, 18. Russell, 19. Latifi, DNF. Gasly
2020-07-19T15:02:27Z: Final top 10 order, then: 1. Hamilton, 2. Verstappen, 3. Bottas, 4. Stroll, 5. Albon, 6. Vettel, 7. Perez, 8. Ricciardo, 9. Magnussen, 10. Sainz
2020-07-19T14:53:57Z: Hamilton almost stumbles as he gets out of his dominant W11, the only foot he put wrong all weekend...
2020-07-19T14:52:32Z: Ex-Arsenal player Robert Pires gives Hamilton the thumbs-up. Thankfully, Pires isn't in charge of delivering penalties this weekend...
2020-07-19T14:51:11Z: Stroll claims fourth place, bagging Racing Point's highest finish of the year, with Albon fifth, Vettel sixth, Perez, Ricciardo, Magnussen and Sainz completing the top 10.
2020-07-19T14:50:25Z: Verstappen hangs on by fractions to keep second, after a very last minute suspension change, beating Bottas by mere metres.
2020-07-19T14:49:31Z: Setting a 1m16.627s, Lewis Hamilton wins the Hungarian Grand Prix!
2020-07-19T14:47:42Z: Hamilton does a 1m17.497s to claim the fastest lap. And he can probably go even quicker.
2020-07-19T14:47:33Z: With Vettel running wide and losing that place to Albon, it has also invited Perez into the fight but he has to ease off to allow Hamilton to lap him.
2020-07-19T14:46:59Z: Verstappen is now, firmly, in Bottas' sights. Game on.
2020-07-19T14:45:47Z: Albon has now passed Vettel for fifth, pouncing on a Vettel wide moment at T2 to claim the place.
2020-07-19T14:45:13Z: Hamilton pits for soft tyres, a steady stop from Mercedes and Hamilton returns 6s clear of Verstappen.
2020-07-19T14:44:27Z: Bottas is now 3s off of Verstappen now, this is going to be a last-lap showdown at this rate.
2020-07-19T14:42:24Z: But Hamilton, clearly with some excellent diplomacy skills, has managed to secure some soft boots - but he'll have to wait a couple of laps for them.
2020-07-19T14:40:16Z: We're currently watching a battle between Kvyat, Ocon and Norris for 12th. Even Sainz doesn't get this amount of airtime.
2020-07-19T14:39:47Z: Bottas' progress to Verstappen was halted a bit by traffic, but the Finn has closed the gap to 8.5s. Verstappen putting in a mighty drive to hang on, though.
2020-07-19T14:37:57Z: Sainz gets the move done on Leclerc at Turn 1 a lap later as he eases the Ferrari driver wide on the exit of the corner.
2020-07-19T14:37:02Z: Sainz is still badgering Leclerc for P10 having eased off for a few laps. The McLaren driver pulls alongside the Ferrari and the pair come within inches of banging wheels.
2020-07-19T14:35:14Z: Albon's within touching distance of Vettel as well. But, Albon's under investigation for grid-drying: F1 Hungarian GP: Red Bull summoned by stewards for drying Albon's grid slotRed Bull has been summoned by the Formula 1 race stewards for drying Alexander Albon's grid slot ahead of Sunday's Hungarian Grand Prix
2020-07-19T14:33:40Z: Ricciardo is chipping away at the gap to Perez in the fight for P7, dropping the deficit to under two seconds, while the Racing Point driver is also closing in on Albon in sixth place. That battle looks set to come alive in the closing laps.
2020-07-19T14:32:48Z: Bottas is now just 10s off of Verstappen now - although he was rather helped by some traffic.
2020-07-19T14:30:44Z: Stroll, having emerged on the road ahead of Vettel, has cracked the gap open to 4.6s.
2020-07-19T14:28:42Z: Bottas will, according to our favourite TV graphic, be close to Verstappen in nine laps, with two difficulties/pass on the scale. Again, official units. Don't make me get the Big Book of Scientific Formulae out.
2020-07-19T14:26:57Z: Stroll's come in for fresh boots, having had a free stop over Vettel. Hard tyres for the Racing Point.
2020-07-19T14:26:16Z: Then, Bottas did a 1m17.913s. That's quite quick.
2020-07-19T14:25:45Z: Sainz has hit future team-mate and car in his sights as he closes in on Leclerc in 10th place. The Ferrari driver locks up at Turn 1 which invites Sainz to have a closer look but he opts against a bold move.
2020-07-19T14:25:40Z: And on those fresh tyres, Bottas posts a 1m18.435s lap.
2020-07-19T14:24:51Z: Vettel's slowly chipping away at Stroll now - he's 22s behind the Racing Point, but he's just taking out little snippets of time away from him.
2020-07-19T14:23:19Z: Bottas pits! He puts on some hard compound tyres, having had basically a free pitstop over Stroll. So that'll put Verstappen under a bit of pressure...
2020-07-19T14:22:21Z: A bad couple of laps for Haas, as Grosjean is overtaken by Ocon and Norris on consecutive laps. The French driver asks his race engineer if everything is good with his car, and he is told all is OK.
2020-07-19T14:21:16Z: Traffic does rather hinder Bottas there, who loses about a second to Verstappen that time around.
2020-07-19T14:19:28Z: Just like that Ricciardo gets ahead of Magnussen at Turn 2 for P8.
2020-07-19T14:18:42Z: And Bottas is within range of Verstappen, but the Dutchman's got the legs on him over this lap so far.
2020-07-19T14:18:31Z: That stint could pay off for Ricciardo later in the race. He is now in P9 but has fresh medium tyres to attack Magnussen and Perez ahead of him.
2020-07-19T14:16:50Z: Bottas is really up with Verstappen now, just a second behind.
2020-07-19T14:15:32Z: Ricciardo pits from fifth, banging on some medium tyres for the last 25 laps.
2020-07-19T14:14:32Z: Hamilton has lapped Leclerc. That kinda sums up Ferrari's year, doesn't it?
2020-07-19T14:13:24Z: Latifi has spun at Turn 5. He avoids the barrier and is able to continue but it marks another bad moment in his afternoon.
2020-07-19T14:12:04Z: It's lap 42. Hamilton is almost 20s clear of Verstappen, but behind those two it's pretty much anything goes at this point.
2020-07-19T14:11:35Z: Sainz the latest to pit having been putting pressure on Ricciardo. The McLaren driver comes out in P11 behind Leclerc.
2020-07-19T14:10:07Z: Magnussen, the last of the drivers to pit in this race, tries to defend P9 from Perez but the pace difference between the two is too great as the Mexican keeps it pinned on the exit of Turn 1 to take the inside line for Turn 2 and get the move done.
2020-07-19T14:09:57Z: Bottas will be in striking distance of Verstappen in five laps, with about 10 difficulties/pass on the scale. It's an SI unit, look it up.
2020-07-19T14:08:09Z: A 1m18.945s lap from Bottas - the Finn is flying out there.
2020-07-19T14:06:18Z: Hamilton also pitted from the lead.
2020-07-19T14:05:50Z: Another fastest lap for Bottas, he's just 7.2s behind Verstappen now having done a 1m19.656s. Wow.
2020-07-19T14:05:03Z: Verstappen also now pits from second, taking on fresh hard boots for the rest of the race.
2020-07-19T14:04:27Z: Magnussen and Perez also stop from fifth and sixth.
2020-07-19T14:03:54Z: Bottas did a 1m20.349s on fresh mediums, so it was pretty cut-and-dried that he'd get P3.
2020-07-19T14:03:44Z: Just as we say that, Grosjean pits for Haas having been overtaken by Sainz.
2020-07-19T14:03:25Z: Albon pits, and Stroll also comes in for new slicks to be undercut by Bottas.
2020-07-19T14:01:38Z: The Haas drivers are very much running their own race having pitted for dry tyres after the formation lap. Magnussen is fifth and Grosjean is ninth but both are yet to pit (technically) in the race.
2020-07-19T14:01:29Z: That'll give Bottas a shot at undercutting Stroll, then, who doesn't react to that.
2020-07-19T14:00:46Z: Bottas has pitted from fourth, presumably with new information on the rain, to take mediums.
2020-07-19T13:59:43Z: But on the next lap around Leclerc gets the move done through the same corners. Equally impressive, and fair, racing.
2020-07-19T13:59:23Z: This Norris/Leclerc battle is excellent - now THIS is podracing.
2020-07-19T13:58:34Z: Some bold defensive driving by Norris to keep Leclerc behind him through Turns 2 and 3. Impressive racing.
2020-07-19T13:57:23Z: Albon was 0.8s faster on the previous lap than Magnussen, so he's closing in with desires on fifth place.
2020-07-19T13:57:09Z: Vettel pits from P8 just as he catches up to the back of Grosjean. He has also switched to the hard tyres like team-mate Leclerc did - but dark clouds are threatening rain so that move could backfire.
2020-07-19T13:55:46Z: That Red Bull's looking a bit better in race trim, isn't it? Albon's carving through, and Verstappen had that good start to the race.
2020-07-19T13:55:06Z: A 1m21.265s for Hamilton, further extending that now-14s advantage.
2020-07-19T13:54:33Z: Albon has moved ahead of Grosjean at Turn 1 to take sixth place.
2020-07-19T13:53:52Z: Apparently the rain will be here in five minutes or so, and it'll last for about five minutes. We wait with umbrellas poised.
2020-07-19T13:53:03Z: Stroll's still got a slight edge on Bottas as it stands, the Finn drops out of DRS range.
2020-07-19T13:49:33Z: Perez, who has clean air in front of him, is cutting into the gap to Vettel in front of him who is struggling with tyre wear. In two laps the gap has shrunk from 5s to 3.6s.
2020-07-19T13:48:40Z: Hamilton did a 1m21.341s - so he's not MASSIVELY struggling.
2020-07-19T13:48:20Z: Bottas is now quite close to Stroll. He's been whittling away at his advantage.
2020-07-19T13:46:23Z: The overtake-o-meter now says Bottas' chance to pass Stroll is now a hard-mode challenge. As we said last weekend, these feel very arbitrary.
2020-07-19T13:44:51Z: 12s between Hamilton and Verstappen, then. But there's still rain due...
2020-07-19T13:44:23Z: Life isn't getting much easier for Leclerc who is fending off a train of Perez, Ricciardo and Sainz. Much to his relief the Ferrari driver gets the call from his pitwall to pit and comes out into P15.
2020-07-19T13:43:44Z: This has been a real weekend of tyre wear. If you saw the F2 race earlier, Ghiotto stayed on one set and was just 0.4s from being passed by Ilott - but hung on until the end.
2020-07-19T13:42:17Z: Leclerc doesn't make it so tricky for Ferrari team-mate Vettel as the German driver quickly gets past into eighth place. Leclerc is really struggling on the soft tyres.
2020-07-19T13:41:41Z: Stroll's keeping enough in hand over Bottas thus far, not letting the Mercedes ace get too close.
2020-07-19T13:41:05Z: Red Bull answers Albon's call as he powers along the start/finish straight to pass Leclerc in the braking zone for the first corner. Albon is up to seventh and charging after the Haas pair.
2020-07-19T13:40:25Z: A 1m21.363s lap from Hamilton, there. He makes it look easy, doesn't he?
2020-07-19T13:38:51Z: Gasly's torrid weekend is over. The AlphaTauri driver who has suffered power unit issues on Friday and Saturday has retired with a smoking engine.
2020-07-19T13:38:10Z: Bottas now returns from his brief battle with Magnussen with P4 in hand, and he'll go after Stroll next.
2020-07-19T13:37:18Z: A lap later Albon goes for the move again, this time around the outside of the first corner, but he can't carry his speed to gain the inside line at Turn 2. This is inviting Vettel into the fight.
2020-07-19T13:36:45Z: And Stroll takes third, clearing Magnussen before Bottas got too close. He's now got 15s of clean-ish air to go after Verstappen.
2020-07-19T13:36:11Z: Stroll's back in DRS range of Magnussen and he's got some fire in his belly now. Quick first sector from the Canadian.
2020-07-19T13:35:28Z: Having been gifted an overtake by Vettel, Red Bull's Albon is already stalking Leclerc for seventh place. Albon has a look up the inside at the first corner but thinks better of it and backs out.
2020-07-19T13:34:56Z: In the podium positions, we've got two drivers whose dads raced for Stewart in 1998.
2020-07-19T13:33:30Z: We've got the overtake-o-meter between Bottas and Stroll, apparently the Finnish driver will face a medium-to-low difficulty pass when he catches up. So that's a 2000 Minardi yellow colour.
2020-07-19T13:32:07Z: Racing Point's race pace isn't amazingly stellar, both drivers are in the low 1m23s, as Hamilton is in the high 1m21s.
2020-07-19T13:31:41Z: Vettel has locked up at Turn 12 and drifted wide which has given Albon the easiest overtake of his F1 career as he moves up to P8.
2020-07-19T13:30:36Z: Stroll can't seem to get too close to Magnussen either - the Dane's been pretty great so far.
2020-07-19T13:29:55Z: Latifi has been handed a five-second time penalty for an unsafe release from his pitstop. Pain and punishment for the Williams driver.
2020-07-19T13:29:44Z: A 1m21.522s for Hamilton, he's got 9s in hand over Verstappen. Magnussen's a further 12s back.
2020-07-19T13:28:43Z: Bottas has got by Leclerc as he has another go at Turn 1 and this time gets his Mercedes stopped to complete the overtake. The Finn is up to sixth place.
2020-07-19T13:27:32Z: Stroll's hounding Magnussen, aiming to get back into third place.
2020-07-19T13:26:41Z: Hamilton now puts the hammer down and does a 1m22.170s to flex his advantage over Verstappen.
2020-07-19T13:25:21Z: Bottas is hounding Leclerc for sixth place and dives down the inside at Turn 1 but runs wide which allows Leclerc to ease back ahead at the Turn 2 switch back.
2020-07-19T13:24:44Z: Stroll also does a 1m23.104s lap to set the fastest lap so far.
2020-07-19T13:24:17Z: Raikkonen has duly been handed a five-second time penalty for being out of position on the grid.
2020-07-19T13:24:04Z: Stroll absolutely steams past Grosjean to claim fourth, nicely done by the Canadian racer.
2020-07-19T13:23:32Z: DRS is now enabled. Here we go.
2020-07-19T13:22:58Z: The Williams driver has crawled around for a lap to pit again for fresh tyres after that puncture. It wasn't caught on TV but race direction has noted a pit lane incident between Latifi and Sainz.
2020-07-19T13:22:50Z: There is a lot to keep up with here - we're doing our absolute best to keep you alert of stuff, but sorry if we miss anything!
2020-07-19T13:22:20Z: Leclerc's released his pursuit of Stroll, and is now under fire from Bottas. Stroll's got free reign to go after Grosjean now.
2020-07-19T13:21:29Z: This has worked out fantastically for Haas, both stopping and now sit third and fourth! We mocked the wets, but they've timed that slick switch fantastically well.
2020-07-19T13:21:27Z: Latifi spun at Turn 1 having exited the pits on dry tyres and he has a puncture. Everyone has pitted and are now on dry tyres.
2020-07-19T13:20:24Z: Vettel had an awful stop, completely stuck in his box waiting for traffic to move.
2020-07-19T13:19:55Z: Stroll came out behind Grosjean, which is a rather rubbish place to emerge out on track. Leclerc's right behind him too.
2020-07-19T13:19:33Z: Raikkonen is under investigation for starting out of position on the grid. He started from last place.
2020-07-19T13:19:16Z: Hamilton also pitted from the lead, letting Verstappen take the reins.
2020-07-19T13:18:37Z: Leclerc and Bottas pitted at the end of Lap 2 to the switch over to dry tyres so it looks like the pit window is already here.
2020-07-19T13:18:15Z: Verstappen's looking lively - Stroll doesn't let him through, but pits instead.
2020-07-19T13:17:35Z: Bottas and Leclerc pit for slicks straight away.
2020-07-19T13:17:19Z: A 1m31.458s for Hamilton, there. First hot one of the day.
2020-07-19T13:16:36Z: Bottas seemed to jump the start, edging forward before the lights.
2020-07-19T13:16:34Z: Both Haas drivers pitted before the start of the race to change tyres, with Kvyat joining them at the end of lap one. The AlphaTauri driver is on the softs so he'll be the one to watch for the rest of the teams.
2020-07-19T13:15:57Z: Hamilton completes the first lap, 3s clear of Stroll, who's a second ahead of Verstappen.
2020-07-19T13:15:33Z: Immediately, cars going off-line in search of wet patches. Those inters might soon become slicks.
2020-07-19T13:14:38Z: Hamilton surges out into an early lead, as Bottas gets bogged down and Stroll takes second! Verstappen immediately powers into P3, ahead of Vettel and Leclerc.
2020-07-19T13:14:28Z: Stunning start by Verstappen to get up to third place out of the first corner! Considering he almost didn't start this race that is incredible!
2020-07-19T13:13:50Z: And we're away for the Hungarian Grand Prix!
2020-07-19T13:13:30Z: Both Haases come into the pits.
2020-07-19T13:12:33Z: The drivers wind their way to their starting berths on the grid...
2020-07-19T13:11:53Z: How Verstappen's car is going to handle is another matter entirely, but we'll see! How Magnussen's car is going to handle is also going to be curious, given he's on the full wet...
2020-07-19T13:11:11Z: We're away for the formation lap.
2020-07-19T13:10:14Z: Verstappen thanks his engineers for the swift repair job.
2020-07-19T13:09:49Z: Apologies if this has been a muddled pre-amble, I planned to lament Yeovil's play-off win and suddenly we've got a hobbled Red Bull to talk about. Maybe that's for the best...
2020-07-19T13:08:41Z: All cars on inters bar Magnussen, apparently on full wets according to our timing screens. That's...bold?
2020-07-19T13:07:38Z: Reports that Red Bull have fixed Verstappen's front suspension and have him ready for the race. Mighty, mighty work from the engineers.
2020-07-19T13:06:54Z: In OTHER NEWS, because that does exist, we have an air temp of 21.3 degrees C, and track is 27.7 C. So if there's no more rain, it'll begin to dry relatively swiftly...
2020-07-19T13:05:24Z: Red Bull might have got just, JUST, got Verstappen's car together here...
2020-07-19T13:03:25Z: With the wet conditions, this is going to be a real endurance for the drivers - which is what we like to see. 70 laps of mixed weather and the threat of more rain. We hope you're Hungary for some action.
2020-07-19T12:59:24Z: As you can imagine, Verstappen has a face like thunder at the moment. This is a race against time to get him ready.
2020-07-19T12:55:34Z: Verstappen had locked the left front approaching T12, then lost the rear well away from the apex and slide - both fronts locked into the barrier. Both rears locked too.
2020-07-19T12:54:00Z: Red Bull will try and repair Verstappen's car, but the team has 15 minutes to do it.
2020-07-19T12:49:38Z: Verstappen has broken his front suspension, front wing - that might be the end before it's even begun!
2020-07-19T12:48:46Z: Another update: Max Verstappen has crashed on his way to the grid!
2020-07-19T12:46:35Z: Now, here's an update: it is raining. Il pleut. Está lloviendo. Mae'n bwrw glaw.
2020-07-19T12:42:13Z: Currently, there's a MotoGP race on which has got both our editor and our international editor both very excited. We'll have the report from Jerez a bit later, to the disdain of people who think we shouldn't cover bikes...
2020-07-19T12:34:16Z: If you weren't a fan of the Yeovil updates during qualifying, you'll be spared them today as they were knocked out of the National League play-offs by Barnet. I am therefore quite sad.
2020-07-19T12:32:08Z: That's right folks, it's a fine/murky/horrid (delete as applicable) Sunday afternoon, and we'll be with you for all of the F1 action as it unfolds at the Hungaroring.
2020-07-19T12:31:25Z: Are you ready? If you're not, you have 40 minutes until the Hungarian Grand Prix is ready to go.
